column4: its debian based, but up to date and provides a refined user experience in comparison to debian and most other distro
I wouldn't say it is a lot better than MDK.  It is certainly better than MDK if you prefer a gnome desktop.
how does debian not provide a refined user experience?
once you got debian set up, it's as easy as ubuntu ;)
Ubuntu is just easier to install :)

Debian does very little to make things easy to use.  Debian says: edit this config file using your favorite editor.  And debian seems to think this is fine.  Other distributions try to provide tools to make common tasks easy.
which is mostly one-time things
debian is an excellent distribution.  I've run it on a single server since 1998
though I must admit that the network administration thing is nice
I have used it on my desktop for over 2 years
ubuntu among other things does install some packages that are also in debian but that don't get installed by default
Ubuntu is in some ways more polished then debian, especially the admin applications
and Ubuntu has more recent gnome packages :)
I understand.  I'm glad we agree.
but debian can be quite polished if you want it too ;)
it's just more effort :)
i.e. you have to polish debian yourself, but it provides nice tools to polish it with.
and debian and ubuntu benefit _mutually_ :)

yes, after sarge
you should remember debian has a different scope from Ubuntu
debian is just more focussed on stability IMHO
